intro: Papuacalia aurea subsp. giluweensis, commonly known as the Giluwe golden bell, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Papua New Guinea. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Its foliage is dark green and glossy, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged opposite along the stems. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated for its unique and vibrant floral display.
